description.narrative: By 2016, disadvantaged children benefit from an education system that provides quality and relevant inclusive education,which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, increased quality and effective management of education and training systems, and increased access to pre-primary, primary and non-formal education, particularly for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged groups

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, disadvantaged children benefit from an education system that provides quality and relevant inclusive education

description.narrative: The most vulnerable groups of children in Viet Nam, including children with disabilities, migrants and those in ethnic minority areas, affected by HIV/AIDS, disasters, climate change or at risk of dropout had better access to quality, inclusive education in regular schools, following strategic evidence-based policy advocacy provided by UNICEF. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of government officials, policy makers and stakeholders who have participated in new capacity development events on inclusive education for ethnic minority children, children with a disability and other disadvantaged children

actual.value: 2014:195 education managers were trained on early childhood, ethnic minority education and disability inclusion. UNICEF is currently working with the Government to integrate and streamline capacity development on early childhood development and education, inclusive education for ethnic minority children

title.narrative: Number of new national guidelines and national standards to support inclusive education for disadvantaged children, developed and issued by MOET

actual.value: 2014:Guidelines on semi-boarding schools for children with ethnic minority background, considering cultural diversity and the particular needs of boarding students is finalised. Guidelines on multi-age preschool education management has been approved and disseminated by the Ministry of Education & Traini

title.narrative: Number of new evidence-based policy briefs on inclusive education for disadvantaged children available produced and disseminated by MOET and UNICEF for policy advocacy and education planning

target.value: 2016:5 (2016) [Including the 2008-2015 Action Research on Mother Tongue-Based Bilingual Education]

actual.value: 2014:The draft of 4th Programme Brief on mother tongue based bilingual education (MTBBE) is finalised and will be printed for dissemination. A draft report of the study on education readiness for children with disabilities is being finalized.

title.narrative: Number of ethnic minority children participating in the Action Research 2008-2015 on mother tongue-based bilingual education

actual.value: 2014:The 1st MTBBE cohort group of 247 students (132 girls) of Mong, Jrai and Khmer ethnic minority groups are learning at Grade 5 in the MTBBE Action Research has successfully completed 5th Grade and transit to 6th Grade in lower secondary.

title.narrative: Degree of better performance of MTBBE students, compared to non-MTBBE students

baseline.value: MTBBE students, when they are Grade 2 and Grade 3, score a minimum of 5 points higher than non-MTBBE students (2012)

target.value: 2016:MTBBE students, at the end of Grade 5, score a minimum of 5 points higher than non-MTBBE students (2016)

actual.value: 2014:MTBBE students of both cohorts have met required competencies of three subjects Mother Tongue, Vietnamese and Mathematics especially results of Mathematics subject of MTBBE students exceeded non-MTBBE students
